bug.author: iandanforth
bug.summary: Following cuda install directions can lead to wrong version
bug.description:
If you follow the link from the cuda install directions, and are trying to install under Ubuntu you will end up on this page: <denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit-70>https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit-70</denchmark-link>
Unfortunately if you select the "Network Install" option and install the repository deb, you will end up installing cuda 7.5 not 7.0. I suggest mentioning this before users click through to nvidia's site in the docs: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/get_started/os_setup.html#optional-install-cuda-gpus-on-linux>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/get_started/os_setup.html#optional-install-cuda-gpus-on-linux</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/martinwicke>@martinwicke</denchmark-link> : Is this obsolete now that we support 7.5?
